A sea of clouds, and at its heart, the World Tree, piercing the heavens...|Rex}} '''Rex''' (Japanese: {{lang|ja|レックス}}, ''Rekkusu''; [[English dub pronunciations|English dub]]: {{IPA|/ˈɹɛks/}}) is the main playable character and the male protagonist of {{XC2}}. He is a [[Driver]] who harnesses the power of a [[Blade (XC2)|Blade]] named [[Pyra]], also known as the legendary [[Aegis]]. Rex devotes himself into protecting her, and together with Pyra, he goes on a quest to find her long-lost home, [[Elysium]]. Due to the Aegis' duality, Rex can use the power of the other incarnation of the weapon, [[Mythra]]. Rex was designed by Masatsugu Saitō, the lead character designer for the game. == Personality == Rex is an optimistic and easy-going, yet naive, young boy. He wishes to protect and support those close to him, to the point that he sends most of the money he obtains from salvaging to his home village. However, Rex tends to be careless and overconfident, which puts him and his companions in trouble from time to time. Since being a kid, Rex had a strong sense of justice and was against conflict and war; due to this, he wants to reach Elysium, as he believes that, by doing so, he can save humanity from its dying world. He fears causing suffering to others with his actions, usually blaming himself whenever someone is hurt or killed. As an adult, Rex is still free-spirited and optimistic, but he has shed his old naivety as a result of his many adventures and the later war with Moebius and can be far more blunt than he used to be when he is upset. Due to having no real family to speak of besides Azurda, he initially finds it difficult to get along with his daughter [[Glimmer]]. However, the two eventually begin to grow closer and Rex proclaims that he will do anything to keep her safe, even if it costs him his life. Rex and [[Shulk]] are shown to be close friends. The two leaders of the [[Liberators]] have complete trust in each other and know very well of how the other thinks. Rex is shown to have become a talented cook as an adult as shown during ''[[Cooking with Rex, Part 1|Cooking with Rex, Parts 1]], [[Cooking with Rex, Part 2|2]], and [[Cooking with Rex, Part 3|3]]'', as well as during ''[[Linka's Birthday]]''. == Appearance == === In {{XC2|-}} === Rex is a young teen with short brown hair and golden eyes. After awakening Pyra, part of her [[Core Crystal]] appears on his chest in an X shape. Rex usually wears a blue, brown and gold salvager gear on a blue outfit which is completely covered when salvaging. He wears an anchor on his left arm and a diving helmet in which he usually carries [[Azurda]]. As the Master Driver, Rex wears futuristic-looking white and green armor, matching [[Pneuma]]'s. It maintains the overall shape of Rex's initial armor, and is functional for salvaging. ==== Alternate Costumes ==== [[File:Rex alts.png|thumb|right|240px|Cloud Sea Shark, Cloud Sea King, Prototype Suit]] Rex has three alternate costumes which can be obtained as DLC [[Accessory (XC2)|Accessories]] via [[Challenge Battle Mode]]. These are: * [[Cloud Sea Shark Rex]] * [[Cloud Sea King Rex]] * [[Prototype Suit Rex]] {{clr}} === In {{XC3|-}} === Rex wears bluish village clothing as an adult. He also grows taller and develops a facial structure similar to [[Addam]]'s. === In {{XC3FR|-}} === In {{XC3FR|sublink}}, and as a [[Hero]] in {{XC3}}, Rex has a thin beard and wears a black coat with blue patterning over a gray compression shirt and wears black pants and a belt. He still wears his salvaging anchor on his left arm. During combat, he wields the Firelight Swords, blades similar but visually distinct from Pyra and Mythra's Aegis Swords. He can combine the two swords into a single blade, similar to [[Pneuma]]'s sword. He lost his left eye during the fight with Alpha. == Story == === {{XC2|-}} === ==== Early life ==== The circumstances of Rex's birth and early years are unknown. He was around two years old when he and his mother washed up on the shores of [[Fonsett Village]]. His mother died upon arrival and his father's body was found elsewhere in the [[Leftherian Archipelago]] nearby; they were both buried in [[Oratory Knoll Cemetery]]. Rex grew up in Fonsett under care of [[Corinne]], raised by the townsfolk and the Titan Azurda, known to Rex as "Gramps". By the age of 15, Rex is living full-time [[On Gramps's Back|on the back of Azurda]] in the [[Cloud Sea]], where he earns a living as a [[Salvaging|Salvager]]. ==== The Driver of the Aegis ==== [[File:XC2-Azurda.jpg|thumb|left|240px|Rex and Azurda]] While visiting the [[Argentum Trade Guild]] Rex is offered a high-paid salvaging job, requested by an organisation called [[Torna (Organization)|Torna]] through the [[Bana (XC2)|Chairman of Argentum]]. He accepts, joining the crew aboard the [[C.S.E.V. Maelstrom]] on the way to the [[Ancient Ship]]. Once there, Rex is ordered by [[Jin]], Torna's leader, to accompany them to the interior of the ship to open sealed doors only accessible by [[Leftherian]]s. Past the doors, Rex is the first to enter a room containing a sword and a chamber containing a young woman held in suspended animation. Rex approaches and accidentally touches the Core Crystal on the sword's hilt, and Jin stabs Rex through the heart, killing him. [[File:XC2-Rex-and-Pyra.jpg|thumb|240px|Rex meets Pyra]] Rex finds himself in an open green field, with the girl from the ship standing under a tree atop a hill ahead. Rex goes to her, and she introduces herself as Pyra, a Blade, and informs him to his horror that he has been killed; they are in her memory of the legendary Elysium. Pyra offers Rex half of her own life force to revive him, on the promise that he take her to the real Elysium at the top of the [[World Tree]]. After reviving, Rex and Pyra confront [[Malos]] in an attempt to save the other salvagers. [[Nia]], a member of Torna already shaken by Rex's death, joins them after disagreeing with Jin and Malos' capacity for murder. As the salvagers escape a [[Monoceros (XC2)|ship]] arrives belonging to Torna and fires on them, but Azurda appears, saving Rex, Nia, Pyra, and [[Dromarch]] and fleeing from the ship. He is wounded during the escape and the group wash up in the [[Gormott Province]] separated from each other. ==== Wanted by the Ardainian Empire ==== [[File:XCX2 E32017 Screenshot.jpg|thumb|240px|left|Rescuing Nia]] Rex wakes alone with Pyra. They find Azurda mortally wounded, but he is able to regenerate instead of dying, into a younger, nymph-like state able to fit in Rex's helmet. After reuniting with Nia, they set out to Nia's hometown of [[Torigoth]]. Nia is recognised as a member of Torna and thus a terrorist, and captured by [[Ardainian]] troops occupying Torigoth in order to lure Rex to them to confiscate Pyra due to her power as the Aegis. Rex allies with a local [[Nopon]] called [[Tora (XC2)|Tora]], who dislikes the occupation and is building his own Artificial Blade, [[Poppi α|Poppi]]. With Tora's help, Rex and Pyra rescue Nia and the group leaves [[Gormott (Titan)|Gormott]] on a Titan ship bound for the World Tree. The group is attacked by [[Artifice Ophion|Ophion]], and their ship is destroyed upon being swallowed whole by the [[Uraya]]n Titan. ==== Lessons on Life ==== Within Uraya the party meet [[Vandham (XC2)|Vandham]], the leader of a mercenary group, who offers his help to them after battling them to test Rex's strength. He acts like a tutor to Rex, influencing his viewpoint on war and conflict when Vandham recognises that Rex is unaware of much about Blades and Driving. He escorts the group to [[Fonsa Myma]] to meet one of Vandham's acquaintances, [[Minoth|Cole]], who Vandham believes may know about climbing the World Tree. Pyra disappears to confront Malos and [[Akhos]] in [[Olethro Ruins (level)|Olethro Ruins]] when they kidnap Cole's granddaughter. Rex follows and tries to fight them but is unable to win, resulting in Vandham's death as he tries to save Rex. Rex tries to fight on despite this, forcing Mythra to awaken to protect him, overwhelming Malos and Akhos with her power before berating Rex's foolish attack. Rex breaks down over Vandham's death. ==== Joining Forces with Mor Ardain and Tantal ==== [[File:RexGraves.png|thumb|240px|Rex speaks to his parents' graves]] After Vandham's funeral, Rex inherits [[Roc's Core Crystal]] and the [[Garfont Village|Garfont]] [[Merc Group|mercenary company]]. Additionally, Pyra and Azurda reveal to the party that Malos is another Aegis. Following Cole's suggestion, the party decides to go to the [[Indoline Praetorium]] to meet Cole's original Driver, [[Amalthus]], via the [[Empire of Mor Ardain]]. In [[Mor Ardain]], they are attacked by [[Mòrag]] and [[Brighid]] due to a misunderstanding. Thanks to [[Niranira (XC2)|Niranira]], the situation gets cleared up. Rex and Mòrag then agree to join forces to prevent a sale of Artificial Blades to Torna. She joins the group and [[Haze|Fan la Norne]], the "Goddess of the Praetorium", meets them and guides them toward the Praetorium. They stop at Fonsett Village in Leftheria, where Rex shows Pyra his parent's graves, and promises again to take her to Elysium. At the final ship to Indol, [[Zeke]], who has confronted Rex and his group in Uraya and Mor Ardain under the guise of stealing Pyra, stands against them a third time, revealing himself as the [[Tantalese]] prince and an envoy of the Praetorium, joining the party. When Rex meets Praetor Amalthus in Indol, he is reminded him of Malos, although this is rationalized as due to Amalthus being Malos' Driver. During the party's stay in the Praetorium, a Titan weapon excavated by Mor Ardain in [[Temperantia]] is stolen by Jin to attack [[Urayan]] troops. The party go to stop him, but Fan la Norne is stabbed and killed. After the political tension born from Jin's actions calm down, Rex is informed by Amalthus that Ophion may be controlled with the [[Omega Fetter]] in the [[Kingdom of Tantal]]. After arriving there and saving Pyra from [[King Eulogimenos]], who tries to kill her as he assumes her presence a threat, the group travels down to the Omega Fetter in [[Genbu]]'s head. They are ambushed by Torna and defeated by Jin, revealing himself to be a Blade with control of elementary particles. He takes Pyra and the Fetter, and tells Rex that he is the one responsible for Pyra and Mythra's pain. Rex is left badly injured and unconscious, with the Aegis Sword broken, and spends the next few days recovering in bed at [[Anastatia's (landmark)|Anastatia's]] in [[Theosoir]]. ==== The Master Driver ==== [[File:RexThirdSword.png|thumb|left|240px|Rex finds the third sword]] Being defeated and humiliated by Jin shatters Rex's self-esteem. After waking up, he explains to the others that he has given up and wants to go back to Argentum. Nia, Poppi and Brighid intervene, trying to make Rex realize that Pyra had been willing to sacrifice her life for his sake. The conversation is interrupted by Pandoria, who announces that King Eulogimenos has a message for Rex. The King informs Rex about the Third Aegis Sword, left behind by [[Addam]], and Azurda informs him of the location of the sword: the [[Spirit Crucible Elpys]]. There, the group confronts Addam's [[Phantasm]]s, and Nia reveals that she is a [[Flesh Eater]] as she finally trusts Rex with her identity. Addam's spirit recognizes Rex as worthy of the power of the Aegis, and tells him to understand the fear Pyra and Mythra carry in order to become her true Driver. Despite not being able to obtain the third sword as they had hoped, Rex is able to intuit Pyra's location thanks to his half of the Core Crystal they share. With new incentive, the group travels to the [[Cliffs of Morytha]] to save Pyra and Mythra and fulfil Rex's promise of taking them to Elysium. [[File:Third-Sword.JPG|thumb|240px|Rex becomes the Master Driver]] At the [[Gotrock Oracle Ruins]], Rex confronts Jin and Malos, who has regained his power as an Aegis by stealing the memories from Pyra's Core Crystal. During the battle, Rex speaks to Pyra's and Mythra's spirits, assuring them that he will protect them no matter what and not allow the world to burn a second time. This understanding of Pyra and Mythra's fear allows Rex to unlock their true power as Pneuma, with Rex becoming the Master Driver as a result. Combining their power, Rex and Pneuma are able to overpower Jin, but Rex, seeing the sadness in Jin's eyes, refuses to finish him. Malos then summons Ophion, who he had taken control of with the Omega Fetter, and attacks them. Pneuma responds by using [[Siren]] to battle Ophion. The battle of the two [[Artifice]]s destroys the ruins where they stand, causing the party and Jin to fall through the Cloud Sea below. ==== Climbing the World Tree ==== Rex wakes in the [[Land of Morytha]], below the Cloud Sea, with Mythra asleep by his side. After she wakes up, Rex informs her of the situation, and they search for the others. They find Jin first, heavily injured as his Core Crystal has cracked, struggling to defeat a [[Guldo]]. Rex puts their differences aside and helps him, forming a temporary alliance. After reuniting with Brighid, Poppi, and Azurda, the group continues toward the World Tree. The discover the decaying remains of the [[Torna (Titan)|Tornan Titan]], where Azurda and Jin reveal to the rest of them that Blades eventually become Titans. In the [[Womb Center]], Jin reveals to the group what happened to him following the Aegis War before the group is attacked by the [[Infernal Guldo]]. During the battle, the party reunites and defeats the monster. After, Rex notices something on the ground that the monster dropped and is shocked to realize that the monster might have once been human. After Jin leaves the party, they reach the entrance to the World Tree by its roots. Pneuma opens up the elevator, and they begin their final path to reach Elysium. [[File:RexJin.png|thumb|left|240px|Rex points his sword at Jin]] While the party climbs the World Tree, Amalthus appears, controlling [[Indol]], and attacks Torna's [[Marsanes]]. Amalthus uses his powers as a Driver of an Aegis (amplified by his half of Fan's Core Crystal) to take control of Mor Ardain, Genbu, and Uraya. He attempts to use Siren through Mythra, but Rex is able to use his own powers as the Master Driver to counter Amalthus'. Rex and Pneuma, with help from Poppi, manage to get near the Indoline Titan, and use Pneuma's powers to slow down time and destroy the amplification towers for Amalthus' powers. Near the upper level of the World Tree, Rex and the rest of the party come face to face again with Jin, who awaited them to test Rex's resolve one last time. Jin is unable to best Rex, who explains to Jin his admiration for Blades, and his wish to ask the [[Architect]] the reason why he created them, but Rex believes he already knows the answer. The moment is interrupted by Amalthus in a monstrous Blade Eater form, as he kills Patroka and Akhos. Driven by his desire to not let anyone other than himself meet the Architect, Amalthus threatens to cause the entire World Tree to collapse. Resolutions clear after hearing Rex's words, Jin sacrifices himself to kill Amalthus. The party stands in awe of Jin's act for a moment, and proceed to take the final elevator to Elysium. ==== Tragedies of the Past ==== [[File:PneumaRex.png|thumb|240px|Rex and Pneuma confront Malos]] Once the elevator stops, the party finds themselves in the [[First Low Orbit Station]], Rhadamanthus. They traverse some corridors until they finally arrive at Elysium. Instead of the grassy fields Rex had seen in Pyra's dream, they find desolated ruins. Rex, though disbelieving at the state of Elysium, leads the party towards a church in the distance. There, a voice welcomes them, and a passage appears leading below ground. Descending, Rex turns and finds himself alone; he is attacked by spectres of his companions, blaming him for everything they have lost. After fleeing these attacks he finds himself in Corinne's house with Pyra and Mythra, who confuse him by acting like each other. When Rex breaks down in tears Pyra asks the Architect to stop, as he was testing Rex to determine his true nature. Rex finds himself in the [[Architect's Room]] with the rest of the party and the Architect; an aged, mechanically augmented man missing his right half. The Architect tells them his name is [[Klaus]], and explains the creation of [[Alrest]], including the cycle of Blades and Titans. He tells the party that he was once a human who activated the [[Conduit]] to open gateways into other dimensions due to his lack of faith in mankind. His actions resulted in the world splitting in two. Klaus explains how the Aegises were originally the cores of the [[Trinity Processor]], known as [[Ontos]], [[Logos]], and Pneuma. The Trinity Processor was designed to monitor the Conduit and that the power Rex and Pneuma wield is that of the Conduit, and that once it disappears, they won't be able to use their power anymore. Rex thanks Klaus for giving them life, before the party enters the [[Aion Hangar]] to confront Malos. ==== The True Elysium ==== During the battle against [[Artifice Aion]], Rex explains to Malos that Jin never wanted to die, but rather to connect with Malos. After dealing a [[Infinity Blade (XC2)|fatal blow]] to Aion, causing Malos' Core Crystal to break, Rex understands Malos' life and states that if he had been his Driver, Malos' fate would have been different. Malos laughs, stating that there was only one Driver for him, before dying. [[File:RexCore.png|thumb|left|240px|Rex recieves Pneuma's core crystal]] As the Conduit disappears, the Orbital Stations begin to fall. The party, following Pneuma's instructions, head toward the what they assume to be the control room. Once they get there Rex realizes that Pneuma had just guided them towards the escape pods, planning to sacrifice herself to destroy the World Tree and the Orbital Station using the remains of Aion's energy to prevent its wreckage obliterating Alrest. Rex tries to stop her, offering to go with her, but his attempts are fruitless. He accepts Pneuma's decision, receiving the other half of her Core Crystal they were sharing and loses his Master Driver abilities in the process. [[File:RexAegis.png|thumb|240px|Pyra and Mythra reawaken]] The escape pod the party takes begins to disintegrate in the atmosphere, but Azurda is able to save the party by returning to his original Titan form thanks to Pneuma's previous preparations. Flying above the surface of Alrest, they see the Titans start to merge with the land, creating a new world, following Klaus's final command. While this happens, Pneuma's Core Crystal begins to glow in Rex's hand. In a flash of light, both Pyra and Mythra appear in front of Rex. After one final push from Nia, he takes a step forward towards them. === {{TTGC|-}} === Five hundred years prior to meeting Rex, during her final battle against Malos in the [[Aegis War]], Mythra's foresight shows her visions of Rex; resonating with Pyra, Driving Mythra when she first reawakens, holding his hands out to both Mythra and Pyra when he accepts their fear at the Cliffs of Morytha, and turning to smile while on Azurda's back. === {{XC3FR|sub}} === ==== New Life With His Friends ==== [[File:XB3Endingphotoofxb2cast.png|thumb|240px|Rex living in Leftheria with his companions]] Rex lived in Leftheria alongside his companions into his adulthood. At some point, Pyra, Mythra, and Nia are viewed with their children in a group photograph. ==== The Two Worlds Draw Near ==== A few decades after Malos' defeat, Alrest and the [[Bionis]], the two worlds that Klaus created by splitting the original apart with the Conduit, began to re-fuse back together, which would effectively destroy both. As the worlds drew closer, they began to devise a plan that would allow their worlds to survive destruction. Both worlds would construct one half of an ark known as [[Origin]] that contained all of their societies' knowledge and their citizens' literal souls, which would allow them to be reborn after their worlds were split apart and returned to their original forms. The Core Crystal of Ontos was a critical part of its construction. However, Origin's AI had been affected by the digitized souls of the people within it, transforming it into the being called [[Z]]. Born from their fear of an uncertain future and their desire for stability, Z hijacked the intersection of the worlds. Rather than Origin preserving the worlds as planned, both original worlds were frozen in time during their attempt to merge back together, creating [[Aionios]]. Rex was among the few people not to be assimilated by Origin, with the reason for this being unknown. Around this time, Pyra and Mythra also returned to their core and disappeared. ==== Forming the Liberators ==== [[File:Shulk Rex Fighting Alvis.jpg|thumb|240px|Rex and Shulk confronting Alpha]] Rex eventually meets [[Shulk]], and the two of them become close friends. Rex also begins wielding his [[Aegis|Firelight Swords]], replicas of Pyra and Mythra's swords, as his [[Blade (XC3)|Blades]]. At an unknown point in time, Ontos, now calling himself "[[Alpha]]", re-emerged to take control of Origin's systems for himself. Having determined that the future had no place for the beings of the old worlds, he planned to destroy Aionios while bringing the new lives born there to another world, where no traces of the past would remain. Rex and Shulk, alongside Z, confront Alpha in an attempt to drive him away. However, Alpha blows all three of them away without much effort, costing Rex his left eye. After this, Rex and Shulk agree to a ceasefire with Z until Alpha is defeated. Rex and Shulk later became the leaders of the [[Liberators]] and made [[Colony 9 (XC1)|Colony 9]] their base of operations. At some point, Rex became the mentor for [[Linka]]. ==== Meeting Ouroboros ==== [[File:Triple Attack.jpg|thumb|left|240px|Rex, Shulk, and Matthew destroy Consul W]] When Glimmer and [[Nikol]] are about to be hit by a laser from [[W (FR)|W]]'s [[Kevesi Ferronis|fused]] [[Agnian Ferronis|Ferronis]], Rex steps in and protects them. After a long battle against W, Rex, Shulk, and [[Matthew (FR)|Matthew]] attack W and his Ferronis simultaneously, destroying the Moebius. He and Shulk then take everyone back to Colony 9, where they show them around and lead them to their [[Colony 9 Camp|lodgings]]. The next day, the party is informed of a distress signal coming from [[Raguel Lake]] on [[The Ragmos Desolation]], which they go to investigate. [[File:A Rex Shulk.jpg|thumb|240px|Rex, Shulk, and A]] After setting up [[Lakeside Camp|camp by Raguel Lake]], Rex, Shulk, and [[A]] have a discussion about Alpha and what he intends to do, with A explaining that they are the manifestation of Ontos's discarded conscience that was unshackled from Alpha due to N's power and [[Ghondor (FR)|Ghondor]]'s dying act. When Shulk asks the reason for A's appearance, Rex explains as being due to the way the Trinity Processor was designed - Logos being the male persona, Pneuma being the female, and, as Rex describes it, Ontos being somewhere in between. Their conversation is interrupted by the appearance of [[Na'el]], who is inhabited by Alpha. The party fights Alpha until [[N]] shows up and fights Alpha himself. The party then explains to Matthew that as long as Alpha exists, [[Moebius]] is not the primary target, and that N is not their enemy. Alpha, suffering severe damage, leaves and tells the party she will be waiting. [[Prison Island]] then releases energy that causes Origin to appear above the [[Cent-Omnia Region]]. ==== The Origin of the Worlds ==== After returning to Colony 9, Rex and Shulk tell Matthew, Glimmer, and Nikol about the origins of Aionios, telling them about how, originally, their worlds were one and the same. This world boasted almost unthinkable prosperity and was home to countless people. However, one man, Klaus, messed it all up and caused the world to be split into two separate places. One was the world of the Bionis, and the other was Alrest. The two divided worlds began to evolve independently of each other, giving birth to new life. However, it wasn't all peaceful, with there being tyrannic empires and conflicts over limited resources. But despite all that, thanks to numerous generations of people fighting for the future, the worlds were eventually able to attain harmony. They then explain how the worlds began to return to how they once were. However, since they were composed of opposing types of matter, they would dissolve into light and cease to be when recombined. To escape destruction, the two worlds worked together to build Origin, a repository of data about everything, of memories and souls. Even if the worlds were annihilated, the Origin system would allow them to be revived. They explain how at the heart of Origin's workings is the Trinity Processor core, Ontos, or in other words, Alpha, and also how, Alpha had deemed the existence of all people from the two worlds obsolete and wanted to erase them. They then explain that Alpha is now gathering power and preparing to depart in the heart of Origin, called [[The Ark]], alongside the new lives, those of City people, gathered there for the purpose of taking them to a new world. Linka questions why Alpha would specifically choose Na'el to inhabit, to which Rex states its likely due to the fact that Na'el has [[Agnus|Agnian]] ancestry and in terms of hereditary traits, Core Crystals get dominance. Rex theorizes that it's because Alpha got injured when they fought or that she's got whatever he's lacking. ==== Rex and Shulk's Test ==== [[File:Shulk and Rex Ready to Fight.jpg|thumb|240px|Rex and Shulk fight Glimmer and Nikol]] The party then discusses what to do next, determining that Prison Island would be their best bet of reaching Origin, where Alpha is waiting. However, in order to get there, they need to [[Ether Lift Research|gather the resources]] needing to build an [[Ether Lift]] in order to travel vertically. Additionally, Nikol and Glimmer request to come with everyone to Origin, but Rex and Shulk adamantly refuse, deeming Nikol and Glimmer unworthy of challenging Alpha, telling them they must stay in the Colony. The party asks Riku about [[The Ouroboros Power|boosting their Ouroboros power]]. Riku informs them that they need some kind of "Trigger" to power up. In order to activate this trigger, Rex and Shulk volunteer to fight Nikol and Glimmer at the Gotrock Oracle Ruins. Nikol and Glimmer struggle a bit against the two, but are able to unlock more Ouroboros power to defeat Rex and Shulk, powering up the [[Ouroboros Stone]] in the process. Rex and Shulk then agree to let them tag along to Origin. With both matters dealt with, the party turns in for the night. Later that night, Rex and Glimmer having a small heart-to-heart. Glimmer asks Rex about his eye scar. He tells her that he got it during the fight with Alpha, saying he got sloppy and had to pay for it. However, Rex kind of likes the scar, telling her how someone he really looked up to, referring to Zeke, "had an eye thing too". Glimmer then asks Rex why he risks life and limb fighting to protect people he doesn't even know. Rex tells her that if through his fighting, someone in the world gets to smile, that's the type of world he wants to help create. He explains how as long as someone's alive, they're always connected to others, saying that it used to be called [[Affinity (XC2)|affinity]], or bonds. ==== Avatars of Origin ==== [[File:Rex Glimmer N.jpg|thumb|240px|Rex and Glimmer fighting N]] The next morning, the party leaves for the [[Black Mountains]], where Prison Island is located. Soon after, they finally arrive at the [[Prison Terrace]]. They are greeted by N, who reveals that the one keeping Na'el in this world is Matthew, which is why N's been trying to kill him. The party confronts him, and N's clash with Matthew reveals to them a memory from Origin, of N's attack on the City and Alpha's involvement with it. All of a sudden, Alpha shows up and sends a ray of lighting at N, shocking him. Alpha's power emanates a fog which consumes the party. The party arrives inside [[The Ark|a memory]] from Origin. The party looks around at the scenery of a house with a garden, with a view of a [[Land of Morytha|large city]] with tall buildings, with one tower reaching into the sky. Rex immediately recognizes the tower as the World Tree in its original form, and he and Shulk confirm that this is a memory of Klaus's world. The party then follows the sound of a piano, and find Na'el, who explains that the world could be like this if they went through with Alpha's plan. A then shows Na'el the Land of Morytha, the aftermath of Klaus' experiment and what Alpha's proposed new world would ultimately become if his plan succeeded. Matthew persuades her that she would be no different from Moebius if she continued to view the Kevesi and Agnians as "things" unworthy of life, and that they could live like the people of the City if they were only allowed to choose it. Na'el agrees to join the party and stop Alpha, but not before Alpha regains control of her and disappears. The party is then transported back to the Ark, where Alpha insists that the future has no need for the things of the past and that conscience is useless to the Trinity Processor. The party refuses to accept his goals, with Shulk and Rex recalling that Klaus trusted them with the future, and engage in combat with Alpha. After a while, Alpha tries to pull Matthew's soul in, but he resists and stays inside his body before N intervenes in the battle. Matthew expresses that for now, he's glad to have N at his side. Alpha unleashes his true form, that of a large humanoid figure with an empty, mask-like face. In a final effort to defeat Alpha, N grants Matthew the powers of his [[Lucky Seven|Sword of The End]] and instructs him to combine it with his Ouroboros Knuckles. Matthew's gauntlets begin to emit green energy, which Rex quickly recognizes to be Pneuma's power. This grants the party the true power of Ouroboros, resulting in Alpha's demise. [[File:Origin's New Avatars.jpg|thumb|left|240px|Rex, Shulk, and A become Origin's new avatars]] Shulk and Rex begin to fade, and they reveal that without Alpha, Origin requires a new avatar to keep Aionios stable, which will be themselves and A. The party expresses disagreement, but Rex assures the group that they will see them all again when the worlds are restored. Rex and Shulk grant their life force to their respective children, Glimmer and Nikol, and step forward into a large rift, telling them that the three of them will be waiting for them at the far edge of time. As they enter the rift, Shulk and Rex ask A if they had foreseen the current turn of events, but A states that their hopes have always been a constant in the flow of time. === {{XC3|-}} === ==== Legacy as the Mentor of the City's Liberatrix ==== [[File:HouseCassiniStatue.jpg|thumb|240px|Statue of Rex in the City's Memorial Hall]] When the [[City]] was rebuilt, a statue of Rex was placed in the [[Memorial Hall]] alongside the statues of Shulk, Matthew, Nikol, Glimmer, and Na'el. Common variety Nopon.|Riku}} '''Riku''' (Japanese: {{lang|ja|リク}}, '''Riku''') is a character in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR}}. ==Overview== Riku & [[Manana]] are unlocked as a [[Hero]] duo after completing the [[Hero Quest]] ''[[A Nopon's Counsel]]''. He and Manana together are also known as Peerless [[Riku & Manana]] (Japanese: {{Lang|jp|技巧のリク&マナナ}}, ''Gikō no Riku & Manana''). He is a mechanic for [[Keves]] who is in charge of power frame repair and maintenance of the [[Colony 9 (XC3)|Colony 9]] [[Ferronis]].[https://topics.nintendo.co.jp/article/3ced4c9d-a5e1-43a3-b16e-0005971ed404 Nintendo] Although he is initially a noncombatant, he later chooses to fight together with Manana as a single unit. Riku is one of the seven wielders of an [[Ultimate Hammer]]. ==Story== ==={{XC3FR|sub}}=== Riku is the son of either [[Riki]] or [[Kino]], and is friends with [[Melia]], who he considers his Masterpon. At some point after [[Z]] used [[Origin]] to create [[Aionios]], Melia entrusted Riku with [[Lucky Seven]] to pass it along to someone who can be trusted with its power one day. Riku was among the few people who were not assimilated by Origin. At some point, Riku joined the [[Liberators]], settling in [[Colony 9 (XC1)|Colony 9]]. Riku also made a prosthetic arm replacement for [[Shulk]], who lost his right arm when he and [[Rex]] first confronted [[Alpha]]. Riku eventually sets up a [[Riku's Workshop|workshop]] in the [[Dunban's House|building]] that formerly belonged to [[Dunban]]. Riku also travels with the party on their journey to [[Prison Island]]. While resting at the [[Valak Peak Camp]], Riku advises Shulk that leaping [[Blade (XC3)|Blade]]-first into battle is best left to the young and reckless, words Riku learned from his masterpon, Melia. Riku tells Shulk how she had told him to give Lucky Seven to such a person someday. Riku says that "everyone" is in Lucky Seven and also with Shulk in his [[Monado Replica EX+|Monado REX+]]. After Alpha is vanquished, Riku and [[Nikol]] are shown working together to strengthen the [[Ouroboros Stone]], which in turn refines the [[Ouroboros Power]] to become the power to [[Interlink]]. ==={{XC3|-}}=== Riku stayed with the [[City]] for a long time until he eventually insinuated himself into [[Keves]], moving to [[Colony 14]] and meeting [[Noah]], [[Eunie]], [[Lanz]], and [[Joran]]. One day, Riku gave Noah [[Lucky Seven]] to use when it is needed, having deemed Noah worthy of the sword. After Colony 14 was destroyed, Riku moved to [[Colony 9 (XC3)|Colony 9]] with Noah, Lanz, and Eunie. When the party becomes [[Ouroboros]], he stays with them and teaches them how to augment their equipment and create [[Gem]]s. While passing through the [[Urayan Tunnels]], [[Manana]] jumps in to fight some [[Arachno]]s. Riku scolds her recklessness, failing to hide his concern for her. At the bottom of the first elevator, Riku requests everyone help him search mineral deposits for gemstones. While taking a break at the [[Ruins of Seebu Camp]], Riku admits to Manana that he really likes her cooking. When the party finds the gemstones, a [[Princess Arachno]] attacks them. Riku and Manana decide to fight together in order to give the others more support, leading to the Arachno being defeated and Riku obtaining the gemstone he really wanted. ==Gameplay== {{main|Riku & Manana}} At [[Rest Spot (XC3)|Rest Spots]], Riku can [[Gem Crafting|craft]] [[Gem]]s. =={{XC3FR|sub}}== ===NPC=== {{Infobox NPC |name = Riku |image = FR Riku Icon.png |personality = Talented Mechanic |time_active = |gender = Male |race = [[Nopon]] |age = ??? |location = [[Yesterdale]] ([[Riku's Workshop]]) }} '''Riku''' is an NPC in {{XC3FR|sublink}}.
